metadata.titleEn: Qilian Mountains integrated observatory network: Dataset of Qinghai Lake integrated observatory network (eddy covariance system of the temperate steppe, 2019)
metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：青海湖流域地表过程综合观测网（温性草原涡动相关仪-2019）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the temperate steppe eddy covariance system (EC) belonging to the Qinghai Lake basin integrated observatory network from April 26 to December 31 in 2019. The site (100°14'8.99"E, 37°14'49.00"N) was located in the south of Sanjiaocheng sheep breeding farm, Gangcha County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3210sm. The EC was installed at a height of 2.5 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3A &EC150) was about 0.17 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Data during December 18 to December 24, 2018 were missing due to the data collector failure.
The released data contained the following variables: DATE/TIME, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). The quality marks of sensible heat flux, latent heat flux and carbon flux are divided into three levels (quality marks 0 have good data quality, 1 have good data quality and 2 have poor data quality). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2019年4月26日至2019年12月31日的青海湖流域水文气象观测网温性草原涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于青海省刚察县三角城种羊场南部，下垫面是温性草原。观测点经纬度为：东经 100°14'8.99"E，北纬 37°14'49.00"N，海拔3210m。涡动相关仪的架高2.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向为北，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3A）与CO2/H2O分析仪（EC150）之间的距离约是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据采样频率为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间DATE/TIME，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为3级（质量标识0数据质量好，1数据质量较好，2数据质量较差（较插补数据好））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。在这封信中，显示出与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，另一个因素是该区域强烈的对流环境。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估计蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误造成的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及4.5米高处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度通量系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，该实验针对异质土地表面，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is it necessary to perform quality evaluations on flux values using criteria such as atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics?
Verification.QuestionCn: 是否有必要根据大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征对通量值进行质量评估？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which data collection method is more effective for measuring latent heat flux: eddy covariance systems or thermal infrared cameras?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 哪种数据收集方法在测量潜热通量方面更有效：涡度协方差系统还是热红外相机？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary challenge in estimating evapotranspiration using the TSEB model related to temperature measurement, model complexity, or data availability?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型估算蒸散发的主要挑战是与温度测量、模型复杂性还是数据可用性有关？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the main steps involved in processing data from an eddy covariance system in the field of hydrometeorological observation?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn:
在水文气象观测领域，处理涡度协方差系统数据的主要步骤包括：

1. 数据采集：使用涡度协方差系统收集气象和气体通量数据。
2. 数据预处理：对原始数据进行清洗，去除异常值和噪声。
3. 校准：对传感器进行校准，以确保数据的准确性。
4. 数据合并：将不同传感器的数据进行合并，形成完整的数据集。
5. 计算通量：使用涡度协方差法计算气体通量。
6. 质量控制：对计算出的通量数据进行质量控制，确保其可靠性。
7. 数据分析：对处理后的数据进行分析，提取有用的信息。
8. 结果可视化：将分析结果进行可视化，以便于理解和传播。
9. 数据存储：将处理后的数据存储在数据库中，以便于后续使用和共享。
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Outlier removal, lag time correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, density correction, quality assessment.
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 异常值去除、滞后时间校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、声虚温校正、密度校正、质量评估。

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the eddy covariance systems typically located for measuring water and energy fluxes in a grassland environment?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统通常位于草地环境中，用于测量水分和能量通量。

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What dataset could be used to validate the two-source energy balance model's estimates of evapotranspiration in irrigated agricultural areas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 哪个数据集可以用来验证双源能量平衡模型在灌溉农业区域对蒸散发的估算？

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of the challenges faced when estimating soil and canopy component temperatures from thermal images in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，从热成像中估计土壤和冠层组件温度时面临的挑战的一个例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of challenges faced when estimating soil and canopy component temperatures from thermal images in arid regions includes image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance. These errors can result in soil pixels being wrongly classified as vegetation pixels, leading to an overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance may introduce uncertainties in the estimated temperatures.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，从热成像中估计土壤和冠层组件温度时面临的挑战之一是图像分类错误，这些错误会随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误可能导致土壤像素被错误地分类为植被像素，从而导致冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气向上的辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that was used to validate evapotranspiration models in an agricultural setting?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于验证农业环境中蒸散发模型的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset used to validate evapotranspiration models in an agricultural setting is the data collected during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, part of the HiWATER-MUSOEXE project. This dataset included days of the year for specific dates and was used to determine evapotranspiration and the ratios of evaporation and transpiration to total evapotranspiration in an artificial oasis covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards.
Example.AnswerCn: 用于验证农业环境中蒸散发模型的数据集的一个例子是多尺度蒸散发观测实验（Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration）期间收集的数据，该实验是HiWATER-MUSOEXE项目的一部分。该数据集包括特定日期的年份中的天数，用于确定蒸散发以及蒸发和蒸腾在总蒸散发中的比率，这些数据是在一个覆盖有玉米、蔬菜和果园的人造绿洲中收集的。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key data processing steps involved in preparing hydrometeorological observation data for analysis in temperate grassland environments?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在温带草原环境中，准备水文气象观测数据进行分析的关键数据处理步骤包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: outlier removal, time lag correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, density correction, quality evaluation of flux values based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 异常值去除、时间滞后校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、超声虚温校正、密度校正、基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征的通量值质量评估

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features or parameters are typically measured by eddy covariance systems in semi-arid agricultural areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在半干旱农业地区，涡度协方差系统通常测量的特征或参数包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature, wind speed, humidity, four-component radiation, turbulent fluxes, soil heat flux, soil and canopy component temperatures
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度、风速、湿度、四分量辐射、湍流通量、土壤热通量、土壤和冠层组分温度

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model make it suitable for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的哪些特征使其适合在异质景观中估算蒸散发？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: separate energy exchanges above the canopy and the underlying soil, single measurement of land surface temperature, refined estimates of net radiation, aerodynamic resistance, component temperatures under diverse vegetation types and climates
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 分离冠层以上和下层土壤的能量交换、地表温度的单次测量、净辐射的精确估算、空气动力学阻力、不同植被类型和气候下的组成温度。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the sampling frequency used in the data collection method involving eddy covariance systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在涉及涡度协方差系统的数据收集方法中使用的采样频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the elevation of the field observation site where meteorological parameters were measured every 10 minutes?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 气象参数每10分钟测量一次的现场观察地点的海拔是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is an eddy covariance system in the context of hydrometeorological observations?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象观测的背景下，涡度协方差系统是一种用于测量和分析气体（如水汽和二氧化碳）在大气与地表之间交换的工具。
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance (EC) system is a data collection method used for measuring and analyzing turbulent fluxes, such as heat, water vapor, and carbon dioxide, in the atmosphere. In the context of hydrometeorological observations, it involves using instruments like sonic anemometers and gas analyzers to capture high-frequency data (e.g., 10 Hz) on these fluxes. The system allows for the computation of fluxes over a surface, providing insights into processes such as evapotranspiration, by assessing the exchange of energy and mass between the land surface and the atmosphere.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统是一种用于测量和分析湍流通量（如热量、水蒸气和二氧化碳）的方法。在水文气象观测的背景下，它涉及使用超声波风速仪和气体分析仪等仪器，以捕获高频数据（例如，10 Hz）来测量这些通量。该系统允许计算表面的通量，为评估地表与大气之间能量和物质交换的过程（如蒸散发）提供了洞察。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'two-source energy balance (TSEB) model' mean in terms of estimating evapotranspiration?
Definition.QuestionCn: “两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型”在估算蒸散发方面的意思是什么。
Definition.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is a conceptual framework used to estimate evapotranspiration (ET) by separately accounting for the energy exchanges of soil and vegetation components. It assumes that the surface energy partition occurs both above the canopy and under the soil. This model helps in distinguishing between evaporation from the soil and transpiration from the vegetation by using parameters such as component temperatures and resistances. The TSEB model is particularly beneficial for heterogeneous landscapes, where soil and vegetation have different temperatures and energy exchange characteristics.
Definition.AnswerCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型是一种概念框架，用于通过分别考虑土壤和植被组件的能量交换来估算蒸散发（ET）。该模型假设表面能量的分配发生在树冠上方和土壤下方。TSEB模型有助于区分土壤的蒸发和植被的蒸腾，使用的参数包括组件温度和阻力。TSEB模型在异质景观中尤其有益，因为土壤和植被具有不同的温度和能量交换特性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes in the context of evapotranspiration studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在蒸散发研究中使用稳定氧和氢同位素的意义是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes are used in evapotranspiration studies to validate the ratios of evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) to total evapotranspiration (ET). Isotope techniques help in tracing the sources of water vapor, distinguishing between evaporation and transpiration components. In the context of these studies, stable isotopes provide a method for verifying model outputs, such as those produced by the TSEB model, by offering independent measurements of the water cycle processes. This enhances the understanding of E and T contributions to ET, particularly in heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 稳定的氧和氢同位素被用于蒸散发研究，以验证蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）与总蒸散发（ET）之间的比率。同位素技术有助于追踪水蒸气的来源，区分蒸发和蒸腾的成分。在这些研究的背景下，稳定同位素提供了一种验证模型输出的方法，例如TSEB模型所产生的，通过提供水循环过程的独立测量。这增强了对E和T对ET贡献的理解，特别是在异质景观中。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences between the data collection methods used at the Qinghai Lake hydrometeorological observation site and the Daman superstation for measuring evapotranspiration and related parameters?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 青海湖水文气象观测站和达曼超级站在测量蒸散发及相关参数时所使用的数据收集方法的相似性和差异性是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both sites utilize high-frequency sampling techniques, with the Qinghai Lake site using a sampling frequency of 10 Hz for eddy covariance data, while the Daman superstation collects similar frequency data for turbulent fluxes. However, the Qinghai Lake site focuses on hydrometeorological measurements with a focus on grassland ecosystems, while the Daman superstation employs a thermal infrared camera for precise temperature measurements in an irrigated agricultural setting.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 两个站点都采用高频采样技术，青海湖站的涡度协方差数据采样频率为10 Hz，而达曼超级站则以类似频率收集湍流通量数据。然而，青海湖站专注于水文气象测量，重点关注草地生态系统，而达曼超级站则使用热红外相机进行精确的温度测量，主要用于灌溉农业环境。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In terms of dataset quality control, how do the approaches to filtering and evaluating data quality differ between the observations at the Qinghai Lake site and the methods used in the TSEB model validation?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在数据集质量控制方面，青海湖站点的观测数据过滤和评估数据质量的方法与TSEB模型验证中使用的方法有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Qinghai Lake site utilizes quality control measures like removing data during instrument errors and rainfall, with missing data marked distinctively. In contrast, TSEB model validation involves separating soil and canopy temperatures, accounting for uncertainties in surface radiometric temperatures, and evaluating the model performance using metrics like mean bias and RMSE against observed measurements.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 青海湖站点采用质量控制措施，如在仪器错误和降雨期间删除数据，并将缺失数据标记为明显的不同。相比之下，TSEB模型验证涉及分离土壤和冠层温度，考虑表面辐射温度的不确定性，并使用均方偏差和均方根误差等指标评估模型性能，与观测测量结果进行比较。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What considerations should be taken into account when interpreting the quality indicators of heat and carbon dioxide flux data from a dataset collected with an eddy covariance system?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在解释使用涡度协方差系统收集的热量和二氧化碳通量数据的质量指标时，应考虑哪些因素？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The quality indicators for heat and carbon dioxide flux data must account for factors such as atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity, which are essential for accurate data interpretation. These indicators can vary depending on environmental conditions and measurement accuracy, and they are categorized into different quality levels to assist with the evaluation of data reliability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 热量和二氧化碳通量数据的质量指标必须考虑大气稳定性和湍流相似性等因素，这对于准确的数据解释至关重要。这些指标可能会因环境条件和测量精度而有所不同，并被分为不同的质量等级，以帮助评估数据的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to measure evapotranspiration accurately using one-source models in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用单源模型准确测量蒸散发是具有挑战性的。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge in accurately measuring evapotranspiration using one-source models in heterogeneous landscapes is due to the diverse temperatures and resistance to energy exchange between soil and vegetation components. One-source models simplify the complex interactions and may fail to account for the distinct thermal and resistance characteristics of soil and canopy, leading to inaccuracies in evapotranspiration estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，使用单源模型准确测量蒸散发的挑战在于土壤和植被组件之间的温度和能量交换阻力的多样性。单源模型简化了复杂的相互作用，可能未能考虑土壤和树冠的不同热特性和阻力特征，从而导致蒸散发估算的不准确。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the primary causes of uncertainties in estimating heat fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域中，估算热通量的不确定性主要来源于哪些因素？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Uncertainties in estimating heat fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas are primarily caused by the difficulty in accurately determining the surface-air temperature difference, classification errors in image data, and the complex energy exchanges that occur in such environments. These errors affect the reliability of models such as the TSEB in estimating heat fluxes, as they can lead to inaccuracies in soil and canopy component temperature measurements and subsequent energy balance calculations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，估计热通量的不确定性主要源于准确确定表面与空气温度差的困难、图像数据中的分类错误以及此类环境中发生的复杂能量交换。这些误差影响了诸如TSEB模型在估计热通量时的可靠性，因为它们可能导致土壤和冠层组件温度测量以及后续能量平衡计算的准确性下降。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using an eddy covariance (EC) system with an incomplete energy balance closure on the accuracy of surface flux measurements?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用能量平衡闭合不完整的涡度协方差（EC）系统对表面通量测量的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using an EC system with an incomplete energy balance closure can lead to inaccuracies in surface flux measurements, as the system might not fully account for all the available energy. This can result in errors in estimating latent and sensible heat fluxes, especially in environments with strong advective conditions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用能量平衡闭合不完全的涡度协方差（EC）系统可能导致表面通量测量的不准确，因为该系统可能没有完全考虑所有可用的能量。这可能导致在强对流条件下，潜热和显热通量估计的错误。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the selection of data processing techniques, such as Eddypro software, impact the quality and reliability of flux data in meteorological observations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 数据处理技术的选择，例如Eddypro软件，如何影响气象观测中通量数据的质量和可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The selection of data processing techniques, like Eddypro software, can significantly impact the quality and reliability of flux data by implementing steps such as outlier removal, coordinate rotation, and various corrections. These processes ensure that the data is accurate and representative, which is crucial for conducting reliable meteorological observations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 数据处理技术的选择，如Eddypro软件，可以显著影响通量数据的质量和可靠性，通过实施诸如异常值去除、坐标旋转和各种校正等步骤。这些过程确保数据的准确性和代表性，这对于进行可靠的气象观测至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedural steps used to process raw data collected by an eddy covariance system for hydrometeorological observations in a temperate grassland?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理温带草原水文气象观测的涡度协方差系统收集的原始数据的程序步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The raw data collected by an eddy covariance system are processed using Eddypro software to generate 30-minute data intervals. The main steps include outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation (double coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, quality assessments of flux values are conducted, focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Data are further screened to remove errors such as instrument faults, precipitation effects, and data loss greater than 10% within each 30-minute interval.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 通过涡度协方差系统收集的原始数据使用Eddypro软件处理，以生成30分钟的数据间隔。主要步骤包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转（双坐标旋转）、频率响应校正、声学虚温度校正和密度（WPL）校正。此外，还对通量值进行质量评估，重点关注大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。数据进一步筛选，以去除仪器故障、降水影响以及每个30分钟间隔内数据丢失超过10%的错误。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model be applied to estimate evapotranspiration using ground-based measurements in agricultural settings?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在农业环境中应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型利用地面测量估算蒸散发？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The TSEB model can be applied by using soil and canopy component temperatures collected via high-resolution thermal cameras as inputs. The model involves measuring meteorological parameters, radiations, and turbulent fluxes, and the separation of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using stable isotope techniques. Errors in temperature estimation are addressed by classifying thermal images into soil and canopy pixels and validating these against radiometer observations to ensure accurate calculations of radiometric temperatures.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: TSEB模型可以通过使用高分辨率热像仪收集的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入来应用。该模型涉及测量气象参数、辐射和湍流通量，并使用稳定同位素技术将蒸散分离为蒸发和蒸腾。通过将热图像分类为土壤像素和冠层像素，并将其与辐射计观测结果进行验证，以确保辐射温度计算的准确性，从而解决温度估计中的误差。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in accurately measuring component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes and how can these be addressed procedurally?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中准确测量组件温度可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何在程序上解决这些问题？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in measuring component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes include errors from image classification that vary with vegetation abundance, leading to overestimation of canopy temperature. These challenges can be addressed by refining image classification methods, such as using maximum likelihood methods to differentiate soil and canopy pixels. Additionally, validating simulated temperatures against observed radiometric temperatures and accounting for atmospheric radiation effects can help mitigate uncertainties in component temperature estimation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中测量组件温度的挑战包括由于图像分类错误而导致的温度过高估计，这种错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。可以通过改进图像分类方法来解决这些挑战，例如使用最大似然方法区分土壤和树冠像素。此外，验证模拟温度与观测辐射温度的一致性，并考虑大气辐射效应，可以帮助减轻组件温度估计中的不确定性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the effective processing and quality evaluation of hydrometeorological data collected at high frequencies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论能够有效处理和质量评估以高频率收集的水文气象数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The processing and quality evaluation of hydrometeorological data at high frequencies are enabled by methodologies like using Eddypro software, which includes steps such as outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and density corrections. Additionally, the data undergo quality evaluation with tests for atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高频次的水文气象数据处理和质量评估得益于诸如Eddypro软件等方法，包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正和密度校正等步骤。此外，数据还经过质量评估，进行大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征的测试。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do specific conditions or techniques facilitate the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in evapotranspiration models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 特定条件或技术如何促进在蒸散发模型中分离土壤和植被组分温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in evapotranspiration models is facilitated by using high-resolution thermal cameras and the classification of visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels. These techniques allow for the extraction of brightness temperatures, which can then be converted into radiometric temperatures for more accurate soil and canopy temperature estimation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在蒸散发模型中，通过使用高分辨率热像仪和将可见光及近红外图像分类为土壤和树冠像素，能够实现土壤和植被成分温度的分离。这些技术允许提取亮度温度，然后可以将其转换为辐射温度，以便更准确地估计土壤和树冠温度。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collected by a high-frequency sampling method such as 10Hz require post-processing steps like coordinate rotation and density correction in this field?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么以10Hz的高频采样方法收集的数据在该领域可能需要后处理步骤，如坐标旋转和密度校正？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In this field, high-frequency data collected by instruments like the eddy covariance system often require post-processing steps such as coordinate rotation and density correction to ensure accuracy. This is because raw data can include errors due to instrument misalignment or environmental factors. Coordinate rotation is used to align the wind components with the mean wind direction, while density corrections, like the WPL correction, are applied to account for fluctuations in air density due to temperature and humidity changes, ensuring that the flux measurements reflect true atmospheric conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这个领域，由涡度协方差系统等仪器收集的高频数据通常需要后处理步骤，如坐标旋转和密度校正，以确保准确性。这是因为原始数据可能由于仪器对准不当或环境因素而包含错误。坐标旋转用于将风分量与平均风向对齐，而密度校正，如WPL校正，则用于考虑由于温度和湿度变化引起的空气密度波动，从而确保通量测量反映真实的大气条件。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using component temperatures from thermal images to estimate evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用热成像中的组件温度来估算蒸散发时可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using component temperatures from thermal images to estimate evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes include classification errors in image processing, where soil pixels might be misclassified as vegetation pixels, leading to overestimation of canopy temperatures. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric effects such as upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in the temperature estimates. These factors complicate the accurate separation of soil and canopy temperatures, which are crucial for precise evapotranspiration calculations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，使用热成像中的组件温度来估算蒸散发面临的挑战包括图像处理中的分类错误，土壤像素可能被误分类为植被像素，从而导致对冠层温度的高估。此外，忽略大气效应，如向上辐射和透射率，可能会引入温度估计的不确定性。这些因素使得准确分离土壤和冠层温度变得复杂，而这对于精确的蒸散发计算至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the integration of stable isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements be considered a valuable approach for validating evapotranspiration estimates?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 将稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差测量相结合，可能被视为验证蒸散发估算的有价值方法，原因如下：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating stable isotope techniques with eddy covariance measurements is valuable for validating evapotranspiration estimates because isotopic techniques provide independent verification of the partitioning of evaporation and transpiration components. This dual approach allows for more accurate validation of model estimates of E and T, especially in complex environments where traditional measurements might face uncertainties. It enhances the reliability of model outputs by offering a multi-faceted view of the water cycle processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差测量相结合，对于验证蒸散发估算是非常有价值的，因为同位素技术提供了蒸发和蒸腾成分分配的独立验证。这种双重方法允许对E和T的模型估算进行更准确的验证，特别是在传统测量可能面临不确定性的复杂环境中。通过提供对水循环过程的多方面视角，它增强了模型输出的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using Eddypro software for processing raw eddy covariance data in terms of data accuracy and quality control?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估使用Eddypro软件处理原始涡度协方差数据的有效性，特别是在数据准确性和质量控制方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of Eddypro software is considered effective for processing raw eddy covariance data as it includes critical steps such as outlier removal, delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and density correction. The software also evaluates data quality, focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. These rigorous processing steps contribute to the accuracy and reliability of the resulting datasets.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: Eddypro软件被认为是处理原始涡度协方差数据的有效工具，因为它包括了关键步骤，如异常值去除、延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正和密度校正。该软件还评估数据质量，重点关注大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。这些严格的处理步骤有助于提高最终数据集的准确性和可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what are the prospects for improving dataset quality by integrating high-resolution thermal camera data with ground-based measurements in hydrometeorological studies?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在水文气象研究中，通过将高分辨率热成像相机数据与地面测量数据相结合来提高数据集质量的前景如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating high-resolution thermal camera data with ground-based measurements holds significant potential for improving dataset quality in hydrometeorological studies. This approach allows for more accurate separation of soil and canopy temperatures, leading to better estimation of evapotranspiration components. The combination of thermal imaging and ground measurements provides robust validation opportunities, enhancing the reliability of models like the TSEB in various environmental conditions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将高分辨率热像仪数据与地面测量相结合，在水文气象研究中具有显著的潜力，可以提高数据集的质量。这种方法可以更准确地分离土壤和树冠温度，从而更好地估算蒸散发成分。热成像与地面测量的结合提供了强有力的验证机会，增强了在各种环境条件下模型（如TSEB）的可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods ensure the quality and accuracy of the flux measurements in such heterogeneous land surfaces.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何确保在如此异质的土地表面上通量测量的质量和准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using Eddypro software to process raw 10Hz data into 30-minute averages, including steps like outlier removal, delay time correction, coordinate rotation, and frequency response correction. Quality evaluation is performed based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics, ensuring accurate flux measurement.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用Eddypro软件将原始10Hz数据处理为30分钟平均值，包括异常值去除、延迟时间校正、坐标旋转和频率响应校正等步骤。质量评估基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征，确保通量测量的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of why separating soil and canopy temperatures is crucial for accurate evapotranspiration estimation.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解为什么将土壤温度和冠层温度分开对准确估算蒸散发至关重要。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Separating soil and canopy temperatures allows for better estimation of energy exchanges as the surface is heterogeneous. This differentiation helps in the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which improves accuracy in estimating evapotranspiration by considering the distinct properties of soil and canopy in terms of temperature and resistance.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 分离土壤和冠层温度有助于更好地估算能量交换，因为表面是异质的。这种区分有助于应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，通过考虑土壤和冠层在温度和阻力方面的不同特性，提高蒸散发估算的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the methodological approaches for partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using the TSEB model, and identify any potential limitations of these approaches in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨使用TSEB模型将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾的不同方法论，并识别这些方法在干旱地区的潜在局限性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The TSEB model uses ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures to estimate evaporation and transpiration. This involves using thermal images to calculate soil and canopy temperatures, which are then applied in energy balance equations. Limitations in arid regions may include classification errors in image processing and uncertainties in modeling due to the complex environmental conditions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: TSEB模型利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度来估算蒸发和蒸腾。这涉及使用热成像来计算土壤和冠层温度，然后将其应用于能量平衡方程。在干旱地区的局限性可能包括图像处理中的分类错误和由于复杂环境条件导致的建模不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be used for validating the estimates of evaporation and transpiration in strongly advective environments, and discuss the reliability of these datasets.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于验证强烈平流环境中蒸发和蒸腾估算的潜在数据集，并讨论这些数据集的可靠性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include measurements from an eddy covariance system and high-resolution thermal camera observations. These datasets provide ground-based observations for validating model estimates. The reliability of these datasets is supported by their ability to track energy exchange processes, though uncertainties may arise from measurement errors and environmental factors affecting data accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括涡度协方差系统的测量和高分辨率热像仪的观测。这些数据集提供了用于验证模型估计的地面观测。这些数据集的可靠性得益于它们能够跟踪能量交换过程，尽管由于测量误差和影响数据准确性的环境因素，可能会出现不确定性。
